readability_reflection:
I felt that string interpolation was more readable because when reading a string, it was much clearer that the curly brackets were not part of the string. While with concatenation, '+' could have been part of it, and it takes more time to read strings that use concatenation.
Example of String Concatenation that I feel would be difficult to read: a + " + " + b
Same example using String Interpolation: "{a} + {b}"
comprehension_debugging: String concatenation made it easier to quickly understand code snippets. Curly brackets are an uncommon set of characters to use in a string, making it easier to understand when they should be replaced with a variable. There was an example of a string that had variable names as part of the string but were not supposed to be replaced with the variables value (i.e. "path" instead of "{path}"). String interpolation made it very easy to understand the difference.
preference_rationale: I would rather use string interpolation. It felt easier to read and looked cleaner than string concatenation, especially when concatenating multiple strings/variables it becomes much more difficult to read.
learning_curve: I'm more accustomed to seeing string concatenation, it is what I usually use for combining strings or including variables in strings. I have recently started to move towards string interpolation for, but I feel that despite having more experience with string concatenation, I found string interpolation to be much easier to debug and understand.
suggestions_improvement: I think replacing '+' with '&' may help with string concatenation readability; '&' stands out as a character more which can help make recognizing a string concatenation easier.
